Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: There is a plan for a large marketing push, however we're coordinating and ensuring we've got timing and all the content ready so it all aligned.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: We will share more details with the community next week. I'm working on getting additional AWS funding and advancing the partnership to the advanced tier. This will allow us to get a joint press release and a quote from an AWS exec sponsor. I've been talking with mainstream media and influencers so once we hit the 1M milestone, we can get coverage all at once and it'll be much harder to miss.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Idk why that just reminded me of BURST. Anyone remember that coin? They had Proof of Capacity which, idk how well it worked but it was a cool concept. IIRC it basically mined coins based on the available hard drive space you had.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: So even cellphones could mine just by the available space on the device, throw a 128gb sd card in your samsung s5 and you could mine. or plug a 2 TB external hard drive into your laptop and mine. I wonder if a mining algorithm like that would be a cool feature for Komodo AC to choose from?

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: @Regnar yea i remember that. It was a cool idea for an algo. Implementing new algos into AC parameters is a cool idea. Its just getting people to code it ha I know verushash will come back to KMD assetchain's eventually.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Yea I'm in the camp of offering as many algos as possible. But of course I'm not really a programmer and don't have the capability to do these myself and understand it is difficult to implement it. but from a marketing standpoint its an awesome idea to have a DIY chain launch service just clicking the box on things like algorithms, coin supply, block size, etc.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: haha I'm not going to talk about Burst too much, I don't have any or invest in them either, but I do understand why some investors would want low energy mining. Hell they stopped allowing asic imports into a bunch of countries specifically because they don't want people to not use their fiat. Having mining via cellphone is a cool idea. then again it becomes trivial to mine via cellphone when you can hold a coin that gains 5.1% rewards üòõ

Content: Trivial in an income sense, not network sense

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I think that's something people don't realize about open source projects, it's not as easy as just copy and pasting lines of code. There is much more to it, specifically the level of expertise and intimate knowledge of that code, how to fix issues, what every line means, etc. We all know how Google and Amazon works, we have their full blueprints, business model, structure, everything. Yet it's nearly impossible to replicate. It isn't about just having the bricks and blueprints to build something, it's about knowing how to do it and understanding how to adapt to variables in design, how to modify as it needs, and how to constantly improve. Anyone can copy an open source project and think it's just as good, or change small things like coin supply, block size, add a privacy feature, launch a blockchain from their desktop, but if you have something, anything on the line with the success of that project. It's best to work with those who know what they are doing.
